alert.note: Alert for Pueblo (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 22 at 1:27PM MDT until June 24 at 5:38AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pueblo CO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Colorado... Arkansas River Near Nepesta affecting Pueblo County. For the Lower Arkansas River...including Avondale and Nepesta... Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Arkansas River Near Nepesta. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, Major Flood. Waters spill over Nepesta Road near the Nepesta Road Bridge. Major flooding of agricultural lands around Nepesta occurs. The river is entirely out of its channel. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 18.7 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening around 730 PM MDT.
